diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Combined Pituitary Hormonal Deficiency (CPHD) due to a novel LHX3 mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a range of symptoms including poor feeding, persistent jaundice, micropenis, and poor weight gain, alongside laboratory findings of undetectable TSH, low free T4, low IGF-I, prolactin deficiency, and LH and FSH deficiency, all consistent with hypopituitarism. MRI indicated a hypointense lesion in the anterior pituitary, which suggested a microadenoma. The identification of a novel single-base-pair deletion in the LHX3 gene, confirmed through molecular analysis, supported the diagnosis of CPHD.
